definition: lit. to see a leopard through a narrow tube (idiom); fig. to miss the big picture
variant of 管[guan3]
surname Guan

to take care (of)/to control/to manage/to be in charge of/to look after/to run/to care about/tube/pipe/woodwind/classifier for tube-shaped objects/particle similar to 把[ba3] in 管...叫 constructions/writing brush/(coll.) to/towards
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
within/among/in/middle/center/while (doing sth)/during/(dialect) OK/all right
China/Chinese/surname Zhong
to peep/to pry into
variant of 窺|窥[kui1]
leopard/panther

sentences.english: Why so many peeps are jealous and hateful of China? Shouldn't we all be rejoicing! ? 2015-know what I mean?
sentences.chinese: 为什么会有这么多管中窥豹的人嫉妒和仇视中国？

sentences.english: From his life several clips can act.
sentences.chinese: 这从他的几个人生片断，可以管中窥豹。

definition: the full picture (i.e. the whole situation)/panorama
lit. see one spot on a leopard (idiom); fig. a restricted view
to look at sth through a bamboo tube/to have a restricted view
lit. to glimpse just one spot (of the panther) (idiom)/fig. to get an inkling of the whole picture
lit. to see one spot on a leopard/fig. a restricted view
to find out about/to discover
to peep/to pry into
variant of 窺|窥[kui1]
lit. one scale and half a claw (idiom); only odd bits and pieces
one tiny clue reveals the general trend (idiom); small beginnings show how things will develop
lit. eyes obscured by a single leaf (idiom)/fig. not seeing the wider picture/can't see the wood for the trees

blind people touch an elephant (idiom, from Nirvana sutra 大般涅槃經|大般涅盘经[da4 ban1 Nie4 pan2 jing1]); fig. unable to see the big picture/to mistake the part for the whole/unable to see the wood for the trees
lit. one spot (on the leopard)/fig. one small item in a big scheme
to mention some but omit many others (idiom)/to leave out much more than one includes
partial view/limited outlook
lit. to view the sky from the bottom of a well (idiom); ignorant and narrow-minded
the view of a frog in a well (idiom); fig. a narrow view
